extension.name: CacheLite
extension.description: Simple frontend output caching with CacheLite.

releases.release: - Update for Symphony 4.x
- Fix crash on deleting entries
- Fix 2.1.0 release notes
- Add a cron cache purge strategy
- Fix issue where the root page was always excluded from cache (#38)
- Fix issue on MySQL 5.5 (#37)
- Tidy up code style - Refactored the database to make it more scalable (#36) - Added the `CacheliteBypass` delegate (#30) - Refactored the http headers (#27)
- Fixed an issue with Excluding pages
- Fixed an issue when the page xml is not valid
- Updated compatibility infos
- Fixed some issues (#9, #20, #22) - Support for Symphony 2.5
- Compatible with Symphony 2.3 - Updated cachelite library to most recent version 1.7.12
- Don't cache is there is `$_POST` data
- Romanian translation from [vlad-ghita](https://github.com/vlad-ghita) - Check context is set before clear
- Fix bug in excluded pages introduced by change in 1.1.0
- Fix bug in `?flush` - Made sure $_GET parameters are parsed consistently (i.e., regardless of order)
- Encode URLs
- Removed references to `Frontend` - Cleaned up accessors
- Added support additional content types via the Content Type Mappings extension
- Added 304 header support
- Localisation and italian translation from [eKoeS](http://github.com/eKoeS)
- Minor cleanup to use newer accessors for Administration/Symphony instances
- Added functions for translation - Fixed matching on page `?flush` - Defaults for configuration

- Changed `intercept_page` delegate to `FrontendPageResolved`. Should now execute immediately after the Page is found, but before anything else happens. - Because of the change above, headers are determined manually (as with normal pages). Supported types are HTML, XML and JSON.
- Added support for flushing the cache on a per-URL basis during `Event` execution

- Subscribe to the Delete delegate to flush pages when an entry is removed (delegate not included in Symphony 2.0.6) (Nick Dunn) - Fixed bug introduced in 1.0.2 where caching was occurring for logged in users - Fixed bug introduced in 1.0.2 where `?flush` was being included in the cache ID
- Added support for flushing the cache based on entry/section I
